The talent, the energy. At one point, Oscar was playing the piano with one hand, playing the saxophone with the other hand and singing in between blows. It was simply spectacular.There was a very long intermission as the second act--Birdlegg and the Tight Fit Blues Band--were waiting on a band member. I ventured outside to the patio to find Birdlegg himself. Such a character (and a flirt!) Had a lot of fun hearing his stories and he even wrapped his coat around me when I got chilled. When Birdlegg took the stage, he became the consummate professional. Singing, playing the harmonica, and dancing in a manner that defied his 71 years. He owned the stage and the crowd loved him.We didn't order any food, but my Moscow Mules were quite tasty. The pour became a little weaker as the night went on (sorry, guy, I wasn't too drunk to notice) but it was remedied upon request. Not only would I go back to Skylark Lounge for sure, I cannot wait to go back!

What a fantastic hot spot. Hidden away and off the main road, Skylark is the quintessential Austin music venue you hear about. I brought my mom here on a Saturday for blues/jazz and she was blown away. The live music was fantastic and entertaining. $7 cover for a Saturday night, cash only. There is one main room, with the stage in the back corner. Luckily the music can be heard throughout, however, seating is limited, and standing by the bar does make it challenging to see the band. We were able to snag a seat from a couple leaving after about 15 minutes of arriving. Out back is a garden/patio with a fire pit and seating. Many use for smoking. My mom had an opportunity to meet the extremely charismatic harmonica player who was going on at 10pm. He was extremely warm and friendly. Made watching him perform on stage so much cooler! Such a talented gem who we would definitely return to see. Overall, this is the place you go for a lively, but chill night. Great mixed aged crowd with some scattered regulars. Recommend to get there earlier (before 8:30pm) to snag a seat, although if you come later, seating is possible, but be prepared to potentially stand until someone leaves. Only complaint was that the pour on some Moscow mules was weak. We addressed this with the bartender and he returned to his original pour. Appreciated his willingness to listen and adjust. Despite this, prices are great!

I'm guessing this dive exists mostly on business from regulars because they treated us like lepers. The bar back smelled like dirty ashtray from 10 feet away. The bartenders apathy and disdain for patrons is smoldering. I can't imagine a more unpleasant bar experience.The piano music was cool though. Seriously, the bartenders need to lighten up.

I have been wanting to come here, and finally made it tonight. It's a dive of the diviest proportions. Chairs all rickety, dark, smoky, nestled behind some mechanic shop down a dark alley, with music that sounds like you are at a high class fine dining establishment. I kinda dig the juxtaposition of it all! However, I was pretty annoyed with the blonde and bangs girl bartender. She was sooooo lacking in people skills. She really seemed to just hate people. The bf tried to make a joke, and she was super put off, and then was rude to me as well. Silly little millennial. She needs a different job, because she is not suited for bartender. But I digress, I will still pop back in to see some music again and take my chances on the ricketyness off it all.

One of the great live music venues and hidden gems in Austin. Skylark is ideal for friend groups and date nights alike. When not watching the outstanding (and oft legendary) performers who frequent the stage, check out the pool table in the room by the entrance or sit by a fire pit on the large open-air patio out back. Drink prices are super reasonable too. The blues HH is awesome for after work gatherings.

This was one of the most random nights of my life... and it was awesome! My friends and I dropped in on a Saturday night ($10 cover) to listen to some live music.  We were treated to the rap stylings of Frost (who was later filming a music video in the backyard!) and the jazz/hardcore stylings of 89-year-old​ Lavelle White.  It was all very weird and enjoyable.  There were so many random people in this small bar (elderly, hipsters...) and everyone was having a good time.  I loved the large outdoor area that was filled with lawn ornaments and eclectic seating.  It's everything in a dive bar that you could want.  I definitely recommend stopping in at least once. You never know what you're going to get!

Cool cozy place in the hood!  If you want to  get away from the ATX crazy scene and hang out with cool strangers, cool live music and a keeping it real environment?  This is the place for you and all are welcomed here.

Tuesday night at the Draught House, nothing like it!!!$2 off everything and the available brews change periodically.  This is the time to try new things.  And after a few beers, go outside and try the S'rooms!

This review is for 4.5 stars.This is a beer drinkers brewery.  Seemed like an endless amount of beer on tap (but probably about 60 if I had to guess).  Really hits every variety and they offer tastes even before buying.  I went with a flight to try 5oz of 4 pours.  Good portion but I was charged $1 which is pretty excessive in my mind.  Other than the price, I liked the place and location.  Really a beer forward establishment with no TV, darts, and tons of seating indoor and outdoor.  This is not your new age place - come here to drink and to conversate.  Dogs welcome and parking tough in the lot but plenty along the street.  Overall I enjoyed myself and considering free WIFi I can  forget about the lack of TV.  For beer, this is on the short list in Austin.

So many beers on tap - pull up the menu on your phone and order after you've had time to leisurely peruse the list.  The DH beers are $2 off on Sundays and its a nice laid back group of folks.  We didn't notice a lot of business at the food truck - we miss the guy that would grill for tips only - BRING HIM BACK.  Sit outside under the trees and umbrellas and play cards or Jenga - the inside, though air conditioned, smells like....a beer pub.  {mushroomy}  But, hey, the beer is cold and very tasty!
Worst tempered bartenders in town. If they are out of a particular  beer that they actually have in stock to tap they don't give a fuck
Huge selection of beers. Had the house IPA Vulcan. Hoppy and nice finish. To top it off, free brats. Sat outside on a rainy Saturday afternoon - under umbrellas and heaters.

If what you are looking for is a vast range of beer choices, then this is the place for you. I can guarantee you there will be something you'll love here as they have dozens and dozens of beers on taps from a wide range of breweries both local and national. If you are into trying different beers, definitely always go for the flights as this is the best way to try more. There are plenty of tables inside and outside and seem like a really nice place to bring all your friends along.

A really good brewery with lots of drinks on tap. A fantastic atmosphere and a great place to meet a group of people. I came here for a  corporate Holiday party and we all had a great time with great drinks and beer. With lots on top from IPAs to Ciders and everything in between, you are sure to find something everyone can enjoy!
This is a true pub. Beer, beer, and beer. Eat somewhere else. There is a food truck, but you can do better.

As soon as you get to the place it doesn't have much parking space. Everyone outside looks bored and tired. Inside is very dark and cold. I asked the bartender if I order food outside or inside and he said "yes" with an aloof expression. I felt unwelcomed. The crowd is older. The beer was great. So I like the beer but I hate the place.

Love this place. Seriously impressive collection of beers and knowledgeable bar tenders. Great outdoor seating. Only downside is I'm not a fan of the food trucks they havr in the parking lot, but that's not enough for me to remove a star. Draught House is a must if you like to try different beers in a super laid back setting

Sunday nights they have all their house beer on sale. We tasted almost all their house beers and they were all great. There is a huge digital display over the bar showing the beer color, percentage, type, brewery, how full the keg is, and the price. Pretty cool! Wasn't too busy on a Sunday night.

They have exceptional customer service however nothing special about the prices or selection. The outdoor seating was quite nice, weather permitting... Because the indoors are kept very very cold. Definitely take a sweater. Even with all the help I wasn't able to find a drink I enjoyed. Some of the ones of interest they didn't have in stock. Furthermore, I ended up with diarrhea and stomach pains for the one large low IBU IPA I had. Not on my revisit list.

German style themed pub with some nice outdoor seating in the front. If you come here on a Saturday afternoon, they have FREE bratwursts that you can help yourself to. Whaaaa??? Of course we had to get one and they were pretty decent too. As far as the beer goes - they have a pretty big menu to choose from, with some local favorites. And if you're in the mood for something else, they also have some wine options, although the wine tastes pretty cheap and you're probably better off just grabbing a beer.

This was a cute German bar. I'm not the beer drinker of the group so I always appreciate when a bartender helps me out. I asked for something light and maybe fruity. I was met with an adorably refreshing raspberry beer, it was perfect for summer. Boyfriend had the Guadalupe Texas Honey Ale - he loved it!They have large German style benches out front with yard games. The ambience was very chill and on that particular evening there seemed to be a lot of families with children. So again, very chill. There's also a food truck out front for any snacking you might want to do which I always think is a great idea for late night venues. Overall it was a charming experience, would recommend to try for the beer lover and companions since there are options for everyone.

Love to drink here on Tuesdays for pint night, or any other time friends are looking for a place to hang out! Expansive beer selection with lots of local breweries, great community of people, and tons of outdoor seating with shade in the summer and heat lamps in the winter. My only complaint is that 99% of the time I go here, it's on Tuesday and the food truck is always the same (Quality Seafood). Quality Seafood is also great, but I sure wouldn't mind some variety.

Great atmosphere if sitting outside...inside classic dark English / Irish pub feel...right down to the strong stale beer smell. Beers in all categories are solid, so combine the outdoor seating on a nice day and beer flights (good, broad selection) then definitely worth coming here

This place is as laid back as they come. With the large, outdoor patio and now - new addition of outdoor seating area in their adjacent parking lot, the Draught House certainly lends itself to an easy, breezy, beer-filled afternoon in the sunshine. But when that Austin heat starts to rear its ugly head, there is a dark and cool interior to which you can retreat. The selection of beers is as varied and eclectic as the clientele here, and are the two main reasons I enjoy this place so much. It's also pup and kiddo friendly. So, win, win for my motley crew when we need a beer at the end of a long week. There is a logistical funk when it comes to ordering a beer. Thank goodness they opened up another outdoor bar in the said new seating area, because the bar inside starts to accrue a bottleneck, and fast. Don't get me wrong, the interior is really cool with ye olde pub feels and a dark wood bar to help you feel as if you're in a true UK pub. However, the line to the bar can only one way, and that - often times - goes out the front door. It does move fast and eventually you get a delightful beer that makes it all worth it!

I have to agree with Mark F's review below -- a beloved Austin tavern has been ruined. Poor management, best staff being let go, the whole thing has just gone to hell. I used to put up with the parking situation, etc, because I loved the Draught House, but those days are over. It's now just awaiting its sad decline to a firesale.

I'm sorry to say that my half joking, mostly serious last review appears to be coming to fruition.  An Austin institution is disappearing right before our eyes (from our perspective).  When the big screen TV's came in and the funky beer signs came down from the wall, we took that as a clue and our ears/eyes perked up.  Now the big screen tv's and blank white walls exudes that old DH "feel" and warmth.Recently we noticed they are now serving "Coors Banquet".  Again, this was a comment I made in my last review about "what next" Bud and Coors? I hate the fact that the "big boys" brewers are slowly slipping in so I suspect that in time there will be lots more taps.    We even chatted it up with a few of the regulars who lamented about the same stuff.  On our last visit we find out that our favorite bartender Sluggo isn't there so now we don't feel like this is DH anymore.  It's difficult to find a bar that you like and it's even more difficult to make that bar your weekly jaunt because several things must be aligned: kick any local breweries that sold out to the big boys to the curb (check; until recently); one 19" TV on, at most, in a corner and on the news (in case North Korea sends a missile, so we know), No Coors/bud/bud-light/PBR, etc. That attracts a different crowd. Place needs to have character, wall art, or something that makes it stand out from the herd from all the other drinking holes in this town, for some reason the new 'look' is barren.Finally the man (or woman) behind the bar is a special breed of person that knows their $hiT.  We'd walk in and Sluggo told us about new beers and had a taster in mind for something he thought one of us would like (he was usually right).  For many years, many Thursdays, we felt like this was our "Cheers" bar.  This is the place we took out of town company to, met friends at, and we grew to love the place as the bar that outlasted all of the novelty bars over the years. We're not sure anymore and don't like the changes creeping in so we're going to take some time off for awhile and see what happens.  It's not like there isn't any other place in Austin that doesn't serve good craft beer, right?  Good luck DH, I hope change is good and you achieve what you're after.
great selection of brews. nice place to take my friends when they come to visit

Great happy hour and always cheap drinks other wise. Dim lit inside with booths along the walls. There is a patio out back with picnic tables and tables. Just had an Iron Claw and it was delicious. It's a black cherry white claw in a glass of Violet Crowns signature drink Iron Whip. Cluck-n-Burger is the new food truck outside. Great burgers, wings, and shared plates. I would recommend the buffalo burger and crispy red potatos. The meat and cheese charcuterie is delicious too.

My roommate tells me I've been to Violet Crown Social Club... before we moved to Austin and we were in town looking at apartments. I don't believe him. I finally went this past weekend since I didn't remember going before and dug the spot. Not as social Shangri La, but on a Friday night they had a sign up for $3 wells and had decent music playing, so it was A-OK with me. I'll have to work this place into my bar rotation.

We have been here a couple of times and it is usually our last stop on the Eastside before heading home. We love the vibe here and you can always quickly score a strong pour even when they are busy.During SXSW we figured it would be wall-to-wall and we were pleasantly surprised to find the bar area pretty empty (the patio area was jammed). We scored a nice side booth that was great for people watching.They do have some decent beers available and if you have the munchies there is a food truck on site. Good pours and a good vibe...
Somehow they employed a racist bouncer. I have no idea in Austin how this happens but it is really sad that it did here. This place used to be great, but clearly has gone downhill.

TLDR: Cool bar, local beers. The pizza outside thooo.___I came in while I waited for my pizza being made in a little truck outside. I knew I had about 15 minutes so I thought it would be the perfect chance to catch up on social media and drink something local.I got a local hefe ($7). It was really good. Super friendly staff. The bar is cool - kinda divey and just really chill. I took a seat outside in the little patio and the pizza folks will actually bring the pizza in for you - clutch.

I always try to stop here when I visit the East side. Pretty cheap drinks and they have had Adelberts Triple B on draft for like $4 when I have visited!! A MUST GET for any beer drinker!I think everyone knows about the infamous 313 pizza!I love this place!

Great bar but man they really need to lay off the horror movies. I had to leave tonight because they were playing Hellraiser 2 and it was just disgusting. I don't know if they are intentionally trying to run people off or what.
This dive bar is great, especially the back deck in the evening when the weather is cool and breezy. Sit back, relax, throw back a cocktail, and watch the workweek melt away.

Whoooo boy. Have i been drunk in here. Solid dive. Bartenders are cool and bootleg movies galore. Plus, dope pizza when you're shithoused. What's not to love? Park on 7th to save yourself a hassle on busier nights. Parking is way easier.

It is what it should be. I love the cult classic movies they run. Gives us loners some entertainment on a night out. When I'm with friends, the patio is tops and via313 is a must try if you've never had it.

As far as Austin goes the drinks here are reasonably priced. With all the hustle and chaos down on dirty 6th it is nice to be able to come down here and chill with friends. Though it can still get busy it is a much better alternative if you're looking to just hang and relax. I will admit that there isn't anything too special or unique about this particular venue but the atmosphere and people are chill. Bonus: Via 313 is right next door and has the most bomb Detroit style pizza ever.
They have great beer on draft. Great prices and good service with no pretentiousness. My favorite place, not to mention they have what I believe is the best pizza in Austin in Via 313.

This place is okay. Drinks are not very strong, but they are fairly cheap. This is the type of bar you would come to just to chat and maybe sit outside when you don't have a lot of cash to spend. Would probably go back, but not for a special occasion.
Drinks are good and strong! great place to relax adn unwind after a bus day! prices are good, seat is very limited but worth the visit.

Great drinks, great vibes, great prices. The place was pretty busy on a Saturday night, especially compared to Liberty which where I was at before here. There weren't any places to sit inside, so we opted for the outdoor. Not that many seats, but still a great place nonetheless.There's apparently a really good pizza truck that is right outside of this place. You really can't miss it. Heard it's suppose to be amazing pizza after an amazing night out.
I love this bar. It's cheap as hell and the bartenders are always friendly!! All of us over at Kemuri come down like every night after work cuz we really adore it. Plus via 313 is also terrific!!

Drinks are cheap, including wells and the frozen alcoholic dreamsicle and solid to great craft beer! The atmosphere is pretty solid with fairly friendly people and busy most nights - even week nights. They also have Via313 outside which is some of the best pizza in Austin.This place is just a good balance of a lot of solid to great things.

A cool little joint with a divey feel. It is seriously dark inside which was perfect for my wife and I to have a couple of beer and a modicum of privacy. Their beer selection is solid and well-rounded if not extensive. The bartender was extremely friendly and prompt with service. Also, Via 313 has a food truck outside. This is the kind of un-pretentious place that I love. I will be back to get a beer and kill some time here next time I'm on the East Side.

Great place to go on the East Side.  Cheap Drinks, great bartenders, big patio and fun atmosphere.  They always have movies playing on half the tvs and the other half has cable.  They don't have a kitchen but don't worry, you can bring your own food and they also have a Via 313 food truck just outside that will bring pizza in to you.  I used to go to the Hideout Pub up north but since I moved downtown this is my new watering hole.

Really rude Bartenders. Went with a friend visiting from another country whose official state ID only includes his age and not date of birth. Even though he was obviously not under 21 and we had ordered pizza from via 313 next door, the bartender wouldn't even let us stay inside the building and was extremely rude about it saying it was "TABC rules not mine." It was a Monday night and at all the other bars on east 6th we had no problems with the ID, unnecessary rudeness.

So I ended up coming here on my 30th birthday in the hopes of meeting a tinder date for karaoke. Well, I got stood up, and still ended up having one of the best nights out solo I've ever had. There was a group sitting in the corner that sang German wwii propaganda songs, the KJ was singing hilarious bangers. Campbell, one of the bartenders, made my night. He served up drinks, cracked some jokes, showed some sympathy, sang some tunes, and just ended up making my night great. This is my new favorite karaoke spot, and I'm excited to start coming here on the regular.

Good dive bar. Always a live show going on during weekdays plus karaoke on weekends. Check in advance whos playing and if theres a cover. The bar is pretty big and has 4 main areas. There are two bars in the front each with a stage. Then there is an outdoor patio and a bar in the back. The bars in the front have a better selection of drinks. The patio is the best place to have a conversation. Usually theyll have karaoke and a band going on simultaneously.In terms of food, buffalo cauliflower and burgers are good. Its pretty standard bar food though. They have good week night specials in terms of drinks.

I would like to add that it's been four months since I posted my review and NOT ONE response from the company. I did however get a snarky response from the bartender in question, Campbell.I wonder if the company is just that clueless? Maybe they just have that much of an ego that they don't mind losing business?Wow, can't wait to keep avoiding this place.
Campbell is the kindest, most sincere bartender I've met in a long time. He's super quick and very sexy in a strange kind of way. Thank you "Hole in the Wall" for having him!!!

Advertised for a free night of music and charged us a cover at the door, although 20 minutes later no one else had to pay to get in. I don't care about a cover but advertise fairly and don't make me walk across the street to get cash if that's not what you're promoting.

A bartender tonight with facial hair wearing a hoodie said "I don't give a fuck" to my friend. She was taking a video of the band and a busser picked up her drink. She looked around and it was gone. She went to the bartender in the middle bar and told him what happened. Tall single vodka soda in a pint glass.He then said " I don't give a fuck, it has nothing to do with me." Got aggressive and pulled the drink he made from the bar. I'm not going to confront him. But I want to let the business know this guy needs new training. Please teach your bartenders proper etiquette when dealing with customers:

Your typical grunge bar; photo booth is fun and the two guys playing guitar there were very talented. I wore my coat the whole time because the door was open and it was freezing out. Some college chicks were in the corner stacking up their shot glasses and taking pictures and the bartender kept yelling at people "no politics at the bar."

Front bar: awesome. Middle bar: great music and bar Back (karaoke) bar: utter disappointment I moved here a few months ago and my coworkers told me this was THE place to go for karaoke. We planned our evening a week in advance and all we wanted to do was sing. The place was dead on a Friday night. Including the three of us, there were maybe 10-12 people including bartender and Dj. We put our names on the list with 4 people ahead of us. An hour and 15 min go by and I'm watching the same 5-6 people doing drunken versions of their favorites but never hear any of our names. I ask the Dj, after seeing a new list of three people without our names anywhere, and he tells me that if we wanna song we should have tipped him a $20 like all the people that went ahead of us. He tells us that tips are the only money he makes there, and if we don't tip, we don't sing. He then assured us we will go on next, this time, but in the future we have to pay per song if we don't wanna be skipped. Three songs later and of course, no mention of our names. I ask the bartender what the deal is and he tells me that's just how it is. So, instead of staying and spending more money on drinks, we left. I will never go back there. Completely ridiculous and disappointing for all of us. So much for the best karaoke in Austin.
Hayley in the back bar.  Runs in a superior gear.  If I owned a bar I'd give annual ownership bonuses to such type of tenders.   Rad
The karaoke was the best part about this place. If you don't want to pay the cover charge you should enter from the rear part of the bar. It's a cool hangout spot with friends.

Located on Guadalupe across from the university this place is the best place to get away from he summer heat for a cool brew that will give you time away from all the tourists or locals . in fact it was not over crowded for happy hour 3-8 pm i believe and the music was amazing . Doesn't conform to today's standards of posh . More how a band would frequent to allow creative juices to flow for lyrics. Great venue for bands too! Wish it had more choice beers on tap though !

Awesome old skool dive bar.  Seems like a real nice spot to hang out and have a few drinks.  Place is kinda divided up into different sections.  Front room with bar., back area to see a band, patio out back, and a 2nd bar area in the back.  Will miss the back area bar unless you get up and explore.

Great place and really surprising.  Shitty Lemonade is great.  The prices she good n variety of music is great. I like this place n chill n frills atmosphere.  It is a Hole in the Wall but a fun one!!
Say what you will about Hole in the Wall, but this place has the coldest, crunchiest ice.

This dive bar is the best of the best! I stopped in this evening and was greeted by the friendliest bartender on the planet. Since school's out for summer, it was easy to snag a table and enjoy a beer. Win!

I am not a vegan. That being said, I was fully prepared to hate this place on sheer principal, but damn it, it was pretty darn tasty. I got the faux chicken tacos, which more or less had a similar consistency of egg or soft ground chicken. The taco it self was built like a fish taco with a spicy mayo, and a slaw of lettuce with lots of vegetables. Whatever, it was good, it gets 5 stars because I was very surprised that I didn't hate it as I do with most vegan faux meats and cheeses.Would a regular meat taco be better? Yes of course, however, I have had worse real tacos. If you are at Hole in the Wall, it is worth getting. The tater tots are on point.

My friend and I went to Hole In the Wall groups were performing at Austin over the weekend and it was amazing! We wondered why we haven't been to a show here before and while there went on their site to look at upcoming shows, and booked another one!We went early so we could also try the food. If you go to a 7pm show, they open the doors at 5pm so you can go in and hang out at your seat, having some eats & drinks. No draft beer, but they had a good selection of bottled & canned craft beers for $7 a pop...Founders Dirty Bastard, Warpigs Lazurite IPA, FFF Alpha King, Epic Tart N Juicy Sour, Spiteful Working for the Weekend - just to name a few.Our server was always there when we needed to order something, well informed and decently friendly making for a good eat in experience. The Burrata was excellent! We ended our feast with the Salted Candy Bar dessert that had milk chocolate ganache, salted pretzel croquant, black fudge sauce, almond nougat and fudge cake. Indulgent and enjoyable with allthe chocolate goodness melding quite well together.All in all food wise, loved the burrata, enjoyed the dessert, but I'd probably skip having a full meal here pre-show in the future.Now seeing a show here? It's ideal. Amazing sound and there's no bad seat in the house but seeing an artist you like in the front seats is UNREAL! It's such an intimate venue so I just fell in love with it. As I mentioned, we've already booked tickets to go back!

Awesome place with a great staff. I was dropped nearby after my megabus from dallas to San Antonio broke down south of Waco and I grabbed a lyft with 4 strangers. The lady at the front waved my cover and the bar tender Melissa was a delight. The band playing (possibly sabbath crow?) was kickass. The Hole In the Wall was a nice end to a rough day.
Love this legendary bar!! Cam, Austin, Laurel, Kelly and Lyn are the best!! I spend way too much money here, lol!

We were staying in Austin and wanted to check out some music. After looking up bands playing, the one at Hole In the Wall seemed perfect for our taste. We arrived a tad early and a small group was there so we sat at the bar. The bartenders were extremely friendly and recommended great choices in drinks. The band started quite late past the posted start time but their set was great. Parking was easy to find on the street a block awayPrices were good - it was a small cover for the band Go for the music, stay for the friendly bar atmosphere

Came to meet up around 10:30pm on a Friday night with my cousin before heading to dirty 6th. We got the key lime fizz and bad life choices. The key lime fizz was like a vodka lemonade. The bad life choices was a watermelon frosé with an everclear float. That drink was delicious!! Highly recommend. The atmosphere is casual with giant games and a pool table. The bar is inside of aloft hotel, so towards the back it becomes less of a bar and more of a hotel lobby- which was less fun on that side. It was packed though, so we sat on that side for a few minutes. The drink prices are fair and it's a pretty causal place. I think I'd have more fun coming in for a happy hour rather than in the evening at my age (young twenties), but not a bad place to hang with friends!
I went here the other day and it seams like a nice quiet place. but then shortly the rush started to come in and it got loud and busy. was still great experience though

This is a great place to hang out with a group. There are cornhole boards, giant jenga, lots of seating and a great environment. We had a group of 10 and service was quick! I got the lime fizz (i think that's the name) and several people in our group got a drink called a bad decision. Everyone's drinks were delicious! If you are looking for somewhere to go for a quick drink or to even just hang out with some friends and play some games this Ali's a great spot.
Great atmosphere. Staffed well. Was there during busy and slower times.  Never had to wait long to order or get a drink.  Recommend their Old Fashion. Original and delicious!
Cute spot for drinks and light apps. The prickly pear marg was my fav! We stayed and played a few rounds of Jenga and then scooted off to the next place.
Love this place! A great spot in Austin day or night, excellent service & awesome food!

Good for what it is - a fun hotel bar.  Jenga, corn hole and pool are essentials.  Also got some shuffle board and other board games on most days.  Happy Hour until 7pm with different options each week night.  Beer list pretty week but they have fire eagle which reminds me of most west sixth spots in selection.  Full bar and tons fo TVs and seats.  Gets busy after work but easy to find a spot to sit and get work done or just relax and drink post 8pm.  Good spot a bit north of downtown for drinks only and just some good outdoor fun.  Dogs allowed - always a plus!

This place is so much fun. The atmosphere is friendly, the music is good and the staff is extremely helpful. They have games you can play such as an oversized connect four and jenga. They also have corn hole and board games. We had so much fun at this happening meeting place. It is also dog friendly. We were staying at the hotel and found this was a great place to start and end our evenings. They have indoor and outdoor seating too. Overall, great place to meet friends and have fun.

This is one of my favorite spots in Austin. Great service, knowledgeable bartenders. While not being able to make everything because of spirit selection what they do make is unbelievably enjoyable for the atmosphere there. Manager on duty (Katy) very welcoming helpful. Do yourself a favor and get interactive at UAC!!

Fun! I like the checker board tables, the open area concept on the second floor. The guacamole & chips was pretty good that we ordered for a margarita chaser. It was pretty packed when we went on a Friday afternoon & the service was a bit absentminded, but polite & apologetic so we learned & ordered 2 drinks next time...kidding, I think

ROD!!! Such an amazing bartender. He was very nice and informative. A bit funny too. The atmosphere is super nice and chill, excellent decor as well. Definitely come here and get Rod as your bartender! You won't be disappointed I promise.

Cool downtown 2nd story Rooftop/Lounge. On the downside, the food is pretty mediocre, they have very few beers on tap and the margaritas are ok. In all fairness, very few hotel restaurants in Austin have great food. My favorite restaurants in Austin are generally a few miles (1-3 miles) from Downtown (East Austin, South Austin, North Austin). Not the burbs! :) Needless to say, the Caroline Rooftop is situated in a really cool part of downtown and has a great vibe. It's a 3 star rating due to its ambiance. They have a bunch of games, dog friendly and a nice view of the downtown area.It's not a bad choice for grabbing a drink and then moving on.
Wow such a cute place and great atmosphere! The drinks were so good and I enjoyed it so much! Went there for a birthday dinner and it was delicious!

Great 2nd story rooftop bar lounge to hang out Downtown for a breath of fresh air with entertaining yard games; perfect for HH. It's spacious and you shouldn't have trouble finding a seat as people are always in and out or up mingling.  An incident last month with my out of town friends- They ordered Hennessy in which the bartenders said they did not have so instead they ordered something else. I was disappointed as I knew the bar serves Hennessy as I've been here twice prior. I told my friends to hold so I can give the bartenders a friendly reminder that they do in fact serve it and they may be able to accommodate our original order. It may have been the lack of knowledge of inventory at the moment, I'm not sure. Either way, they didn't do anything about it. We ended up ordering another round of our initial preference and bites.
This is such a fun atmosphere, we stumbled across the rooftop bar while wandering the street. The bad decision is a great decision. The watermelon frose was just right. Absolutely will be back!

This is the perfect place to spend Sunday funday! It is dog friendly and offer discounts when you bring your dog. The staff is friendly and fast. If you enjoy games & dogs this is going to be your favorite place!
Rooftop bar where you can have food,drinks or coffee from downstairs. The place is so relaxing and they have board games too in case you're in a mood.
Lovely place to relax and play games with friends. It's in a terrace so it's not the best idea for really hot days. Try the Mexican iced coffee!

The atmosphere was fun, but the sangria was terrible and expensive . It looked and tasted like a lemonade made from a mix. The only fruit was a blackberry that the bartender added before serving. I was disappointed.

Food selections were limited and overpriced.  Didn't find the street tacos all that appetizing.  Cool place to hang out and have a few drinks but don't arrive hungry.  Service at first was really slow.  I may try them out again.

Love this unique piece of Austin! Looking for something fun, hilarious and over all blast to do on a Sunday- check out Chicken Shit Bingo! Yes that's what I said... lol and it's totally kid friendly, as well as I brought my 78yr old parents, aunt and uncle from out of town- We all had a blast! Definitely a thing we will do w any out of towners to show them something very "Austin!" Side note- bring cash and be prepared because it gets really crowded, parking is limited.

Place is so.much fun everytime im there. Blues one night. Yodeling another. Chicken shit bingo on sunday morning. Place doesnt need a juke box theyre always having a good time. Beer n wine only heads up

Best dive bar in Austin! Great band, friendly staff and patrons, and great Texas country western ambiance.  Love dancing to the live band although the dance floor is tiny. Also, be warned - they only serve beer and wine. But if your looking for a truly Austin, Texas dive bar experience look no further! Had a great time and will definitely return.

Save to WishlistOne of Austin's best-kept secrets is The Little Longhorn Saloon, For over 40 years, and on Sundays, the bar hosts one of Austin's weirdest weekly events: Chicken Shit Bingo.Chicken Shit Bingo started when a local musician approached the bar's previous owners, with an idea he brought back from California. There, he had seen cow shit bingo, but he suggested using chickens instead. Their response was: "It's never gonna last." Today, the 25-year tradition would suggest otherwise.Chicken Shit Bingo is part of the nostalgia and history of the bar. The bar now serves a large assortment of wines and champagnes, plus 80 different types of beer other than drafts. And in keeping with the times, the saloon now accepts credit cards--not just cash.The best part of the game is the excitement of the crowd, especially the children: "Chicken Shit Bingo is about the camaraderie and the fun.Between 4 pm and 8 pm, locals gather for a unique version of bingo involving chickens, chicken feed, and what chickens do after they eat. All ages are welcome to both watch and participate in this event, which you have to see to believe. For a donation of $2.00, participants purchase a ticket in line: children 13 and younger go first, and adults aged 92 and older go second.Once all the tickets are gone, the first of four rounds begins. Each ticket corresponds to a number on the table, and if the chicken eliminates on your ticket's number, you win a cash prize. The Chicken Shit Official tells the band the winning number, and they, in turn, announce it on stage. Winners have their photos taken, and the next round begins!A valid I.D. is required to purchase alcohol, and you must be 21+ to drink. Sodas and other non-alcoholic beverages are also available. To really experience the dive bar like a local, pull up a bar stool and enjoy an ice-cold Lone Star beer while you watch or play along!

Sunday funday for the chicken sh** bingo is where it's at!! So fun! We got there right before their last round. It's gets crowded but everyone was having a good time and excited for the chicken to come out. It's entertaining for sure!

I used to be a fan of this place, but I had an unpleasant run-in with a drunk male patron about a month ago, and have contacted the business multiple times since with no response.During busy times like Chicken Shit Bingo, the line for the women's restroom is extremely long, while the men's line is one or two people. Of course, this is because women take longer in the bathroom. There is no reason to make women wait twenty minutes in front of a blaring speaker to pee while men can just walk straight in.On this day, the women's line had about ten people in it, so I stood in the men's line, which no one was in. A drunk man came up and stood in front of me and wouldn't move. He dramatically pointed out that it's the MEN'S room, to which I replied that this is completely arbitrary and there's no reason to demarcate them that way if only one person can use it at a time. I really needed to go. He eventually relented, but kept banging on the door while I was in there. It was unpleasant and so unnecessary. At least one other man gave me shit about it also.This issue could easily be alleviated by not gendering the bathrooms, which would also make the space more welcoming to trans and non-binary people. There is absolutely no reason to assign a gender to these single-stall bathrooms, and thus there is no reason for the saloon to not be accommodating to women and other people who would be helped by simply removing the gender signs from the bathroom doors. One star for the lack of reply, which indicates that this business doesn't care about addressing the needs of its patrons.

Had a great time at the Little Longhorn Saloon!  Enjoyed 'chicken shit bingo' on a Sunday afternoon, and stayed a little longer to listen to the superb live band.  Good beers, good atmosphere and a friendly vibe.

Great prices (even better during happy hour), great beer selection and some of the coolest bartenders around. If you're in the area and looking for a place to drink make this you're choice. I'm a first timer but I'll definitely be back.

We love this place, has live music everyday except on Mondays because its closed.We live close by but I consider this place crown jewel of honky tonk, would not trade it for any other place.We may even celebrate our wedding there that is how much we love the place and Terry is the greatest as is her staff.You are missing out if you don't drop in at least once, but once you do you will be going back I guarantee it.

This literally by far the best bar we went to while we visited Austin! The place was packed for chicken shit bingo, which is hilarious and not expensive to test your luck. We got lucky! We won at our first go! We met a couple of the locals who were amazing and sweet, they allowed us to sit at their table while we drank our bucket of beer. If I come back to Austin I will definitely make a trip back to the little long horn saloon.
Awesome bar, great music. Amazing customer service. Good place to two step. The owner came through and greeted all of her customers with a warm heart. The beers a coooooold.

Came up to Austin from San Antonio just to be lay some Chicken Shit Bingo. There were lots of people but there is space outside for the overflow. Seemed to be lots of out of towners. Good prices on beer and a good time.
Chicken shit bingo. Cheap beers. Live music. Good company. Enough said. Definitely our cup of tea.
Went there for the the beer, and the chicken shit competition.  It was great .   Brought our 5 year grandaughter and she loved it.  See te pictures  below.
Finally crossed chicken shit bingo off my bucket list.  If you are in Austin, you should definitely stop here.
Cheap beers and dance classes. Interesting folks who are friendly and talkative. Quintessential old Austin.

Very cool! Very Austin! I was invited by a friend, I did not know about it but came to see chicken poop on a bingo cartoon and have some beer, listen to awesome live music!!!! Did not eat but enjoyed the beer, music and festive ambiance! We had a blast!!! I believe the bingo is every Sunday! Worth the trip and planning for it!

best place in town to find austin's musical treasures. @thelittlelonghorn is keeping the spirit of live music alive. thank you terry, david, diana, and all the gaona's! you're making your mark. i can vouch thursday's with ALVIN CROW alvincrow.com.  i sh*t you not, history is made and your soul will be revived. every thursday night. #freetogetineverynight.

Just one of those old Austin gems you need to get to. Fast.The Little Longhorn - Ginny's to everyone I know - is so unpretentious you can drive by again and again and never see it. So put the address in your GPS and make it a point to stop in one night.Yes, the place is small and the parking limited (welcome to Austin) but if you have more than two drinks you ought to be using Uber (or Ride Austin actually) anyway. There's a street-side front door but regulars often come in the back because, a.) it opens directly to the restrooms, and, b.) the front door is literally next to the band. If they're in session and you walk in crooked (get that Uber boy) you will bump into the guitarist.For a tiny place the seating has been optimized: a railing with ledge along one wall, a bar, and tables too. You can get in here. When you do get in this is what you find.Friendly people of all different types: blue collar, white collar and no collar. Diversity in age and ethnicity. Old and young alike. Getting the picture? Everyone is friendly here. And most folks have enough sense to bus their own tables when leaving - there's a big old blue recycling bin easily accessible at the end of the bar - because mist people here are not so stuck up they need to underline that by leaving their detritus on a table and make the happy - and harried - bartender run around and pick up after others!Remember your server.You get good music - maybe blues, maybe Americana, maybe something else - by a variety of artists played with enthusiasm and lots of talking back and forth with the crowd. And you get those restrooms. By the way, while I don't know about the women's the men's room is clean and better lit than the bar!Drinks are reasonable, the bartenders friendly and it's just hard not to have a good time here.Why only four stars? It's really just the size - at times you just can't get in, so that's a bit of a bummer. But I that's the only downside, I'd say its more like 4 1/2 stars.So treat yourself right. And go.

Classic Texas little spot to hangout and enjoy a drink and music. Have to catch "chicken sh!t bingo" on Sundays. Take the kids and teach them to gamble early! Hot as heck in the summers so if you come for bingo try to hit a cool front when it's only in the nineties.

Lots has changed since it's opening in terms of drinks. There's now a full bar, a better craft beer selection, and a frozen margarita machine. Cornhole league plays on Wednesdays.It's still a hole in the wall kind of place but with more offerings!

Stopped by to listen to Blues legend WC Clark perform in a small venue. From the moment we arrived we felt the unique vibe of a South Austin beer garden with food trailers in the lot and a modest $5 cover to have front row seats and a night of unbelievable musical talent. Beer and wine was modestly priced. Mike greeted us at the door and was a terrific host. Service was a little slow... but somehow it felt perfect to go along with the comfortable surroundings. We plan to visit again soon!

Great bar. Excellent outdoor area with some good food trucks that give a great variety if food options. They have great live music on most nights and weekend days. The last time I was there was Sunday day. The new bartender they hire was great and provided excellent service. The place is dog friendly too. I highly recommend  The Barn.

Was looking for a cold beer while waiting to meet up with a friend. Found this on Yelp, was almost deterred by so few reviews but they were all five stars. Came to check it out and it's fantastic! Had to drop another review to attract more here- they haven't been open long but have an awesome set-up. Tons of space, great layout, super clean and good vibes.Family owned and run- the bartender gave me a few beers to try and clearly knows his stuff, not to mention knows the vendors and breweries, which I always respect.Delicious cold beer, they also have wine and white claw. Highly recommend- my favorite beer garden find in Austin!
A great spot for a beer and fun! Played jenga and bean bags outside while enjoying delicious local Texas beer! Worth a trip!

This is one of the best places we have ever been to to have a drink and hang out with friends. The Barn doesn't pretend to be something fancy. It's a place to just lay back, relax and enjoy the draught beers after a long day at work. There's plenty of comfortable outdoor seating thanks to a million trees. A pool table, open spacious layout and occasional live music occupy the interior of the building. Pair that with several food trucks available outside and you have yourself a decent evening out. We have seen 2 may be 3 bartenders during our time and they have all been very  polite and attentive. The biggest advantage for us is it's proximity to our residence that all but guarantees that we can have a good time without the need to worry about getting home afterwards. We have been here several times already and shall continue to support this business for as long as we can.

This is the cutest spot.  Totally unexpected.  Does not look like its pictures which do not do it justice at all.  I went for the Texas Lovebird show.  It was great!!  Don't miss them when they come again.  The music is great and they are fun and funny.  Moving songs too. The food from the food trucks was delicious.  (I had the Tom Kha Gai soup from the Thai truck.  Other friends raved about the jerk chicken from the other truck.)Inside, the folks could not be friendlier!  It was all just perfect!

Nice vibes and a good beer selection ! It was a very slow night which Can be a good or bad thing. We had a few beers and listened to a live band. They had some food trucks out front which I'm sure would be great for a late night snack or two!

I hardly get any time to leave reviews on yelp, but I promised my server I would leave a great review in return for the great service and I am a man of my word unfortunately it took a little longer than he was hoping for I'm sure.  I was impressed by his chivalry when he declined the opportunity for me to add his name in the review! THESE are they kind of employees I want working for me! Not to mention the great atmosphere, live music, pool tables it's just an all-around awesome dive!
Great bar! The outdoor patio is great on a sunny day if you want to get out and read. The staff is very friendly as well. Good prices on the beers, hoping they will get taps soon.

Came in after driving by for a few months and I think I've found my new watering hole. Staff is super friendly and the vibe is funky chill with a touch of Willie. Family friendly with games inside & out. 3-4 food trucks covering crepes to Soul food will keep your bellies full. It's only been open for six months so get your tail here now so you can be one of the originals!!!!

I was lucky enough to find this hidden gem. While stopped for traffic on Brodie Lane (in Sunset Valley) I looked to my right at the food trailers parked in the lot. Just passed my view I saw neon signs and one that said BAR. This beautiful undiscovered oasis in the desert is called the BARn. It has a great divey feel to it, wide-open spaces, a pool table, televisions,  an outside beer garden and a wonderful variety of canned and bottled beer. It also does not have your typical red or white wine, you actually get a few choices.Its also kid and pet friendly too and it's a really a wonderful place for the whole family. They also have live music from Thursday to Sunday and from what I understand WC Clarke will be playing there soon. Look for Allyson, she is as smart as she is cute. She made me feel so welcome and is appreciative when people come in. I'm looking forward to spending a lot more time and winding down at the BARn.P.S. The other cool part is you have the food truck park right next-door. It's a win win win situation!

We brought a crowd of about 30 on a Saturday afternoon and (w/ some advanced notice) Mike, Mia and Dennis made it a great day! Great space with several different sections depending on what your in the mood for - outside bag toss, food trucks, pool/darts, TV's with whatever game is on. Lots of misters and fans to keep cool outside. Thanks to the whole staff for making it a great experience!

This place is really cool. Local owned. Music Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday for sure the owners are working on having live music other nights too / but just opened in October. They have food trucks right here so depending on what you are hungry for order your food at the food trucks and they will bring it to you as you enjoy a cool beverage .  Currently they only serve beer, AE ciders, wine and yummy alcoholic slushes and mimosas but full bar will be in the future.

Great spot! Family-owned and quaint. This repurposed house-turned-bar is our new Austin hangout. There's a ton of outdoor seating, amazing food trucks, and friendly staff. My husband and I enjoyed some pool and darts while sipping on some local beers.

I really enjoy The Barn!  I've gone a couple of different times now, and the locals are great.  We were given a tour of the place and shown the upgrades that are in progress including a pool table and dart boards (can't wait for that!).  We went on a particularly cold evening, and the real fireplace at the front of the bar was super cozy and they kept it on for us until closing time.  (The bartender is super friendly and easy to talk to).  The back patio is really pretty with lots of places to sit under big trees and colorful yard lights (think mini-moontower).  I can't wait to see what they do with the actual barn that's part of their property.  They offer curling lessons which is keeping Austin weird (love that!), but I doubt I'll participate as the classes are in the mornings.  I think everyone in south Austin should go out and support the newest drankin' place.  Oh, and they have food trailers out front!  I haven't eaten anything from them yet, but I have seen other people eating the barbecue, and it smelled delicious!

This place is great. It's the definition of the OLD STYLE AUSTIN. Just a down home feel. They have live music, wine, beer, and now you can shoot pool. They have very large TVs to check in on the game. They have food trucks too. Soul of a Hick had some good fried chicken, and Louie's Bbq is good as well. You should check it out. The prices are very reasonable for the drinks and the food.
This place is cool.  Live Music.  Beer.  Wine.  Games.  Food trucks.  Come hang out and socialize!  Keep it simple and weird.
Great family run bar with good beer and good food trailers! Lots of outdoor space as well.

Oh my goodness! This place just opened up 2 weeks ago!!! Love it! Great food trucks, love the cute bar. Reasonably priced. Love music on Thursday, Friday & Saturday. Man where have you been?! Out side & indoor seating. Coming here as much as i possibly can :) love love love this!
I really enjoy the shows here. The live music is great but show up early to grab a seat somewhere unless you enjoy standing. Either way this place always make for a fun night!

The band we saw was Tom Ben somebody. Played some covers of Waylon and Willie and an original about his girlfriend with a glass eye. I'm not picky but this place has seen better days and is a dirty dump. Take a pass.

Had to pay a $7 cash cover but place wasn't too crowded. Live band was pretty okay but we hung out in the back to have an easier time talking. Eclectic group of people, quarter pay pool table, drinks were good. The female server who came to the back was attentive & overall was a pretty good time.
It's a very well known old club.  Nice and cool and dark.  Basic.

We came here to see Barfield the Tyrant. His style is considered Texas Funk. His show is very entertaining. The server, yes server as in one person, was super nice and very good considering she was serving potentially over 100 people at one time. Now the bad news. This place is FILTHY. The bathrooms are disgusting. The place overall needs to get a scrub down. I know people come here for the music but at the very least, provide them with a bathroom that was worse than using a porta-John.

Got a parking spot right out front and went in and enjoyed a couple hours of pure entertainment. We really appreciate the atmosphere and good drink prices. Yes, there is a cover charge, but top notch acts make it totally worth it. This was our first night in Austin and we got two shows, had a great time

Went to the Continental a week ago. There was a band which went on at 6:30, second act at 10pm. Here's the weak link about this room. There is actually only seating (not counting the bar) for maybe 45 listeners. We got there at 6pm and every single seat was taken, and it was apparent that these listeners were there for the evening. So if you want to get a seat to watch a show, I have no idea what time you may need to arrive?I'd say go prepared to stand for the evening. Sound system was good, and they actually have an engineer mixing the shows, unlike many of the other Austin venues that wing it. The good news is that this club is in a good part of town, and you should feel safe walking in the evening.

This was one of my favorite parts about my trip to Austin. The music scene is incredible. We attended a blues night during our trip, and I was so inspired. The musicians were extremely talented and couples were dancing all night. There's no way you can sit still during the music, so we joined too! :)

I think I just paid 10 bucks (earlier it was totally 20, so I'm getting a deal the bouncer said) to listen to one washed-out band sing a song dedicated to Willie Mays and then take you long to get off stage. Not sure if another band is playing, but also not sure whether I want to hear them or not based on that last performance. The atmosphere here is dark and depressing, but with a disco ball, bc everybody knows a disco ball means you're ready to PAR-TAY like its 1899. My guess is I'd have a much better time chilling with that girl who stopped me in the street earlier and asked if she could pray for me. We did. It would be cool if she were my guardian angel, but I doubt it. Her name was Brie. Like the cheese. But she didn't have any on her. She was nice and we took a cute, awkward selfie in the street together.Anyway, I'm only staying here longer because I'm pretty sure I won't get my 10 bucks back from the guy up front if I inform him that I wouldn't have paid to come here if I knew the music was just irredeemably godawful. Maybe watching some of these old, drunk people will be worth it. Nah, doubtful. First live music experience in Austin is much like the atmosphere as described above. I'm just a lone, weird disco ball in a dark, lonely world of ancient pseudo-debauchery, where its anybody's guess which will die next: me from boredom and my stubbornness due a sunk cost fallacy vs. One of the old people falling off a barstool vs each and every one of all of our dreams we've ever had...Taking bets now...just hoping to make back 5 of my dollars and then call it a wash. Eh, at least this one old guy in a cowboy hat is shaking maracas (hard to tell) really oddly with enthusiasm and it's kind of funny.

Outstanding venue. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Beer is cold. Drinks were good and the crowd was friendly. The act that we saw was a little weak which took away from it but overall we loved the place.

Dark. Dingy. Wonderful.I came here with a friend in late February to hear the Peterson Brothers. We arrived a little late and were only able to hear about 10 minutes before they started packing up to make room for the next act. During a conversation with the manager, we wondered why they didn't play until 9:30 and were told "Everyone wants a piece of them -- and they are nice enough to visit with everyone -- so they leave the stage a little early so the next band doesn't get delayed."And that's just old school cool.In fact, the Peterson Brothers were so nice ... in addition to producing quite the jamming jam. (I think everyone will know who they are soon enough.)  Back to the venue... It's an institution, and it's one of the few that I know of that hasn't left its roots to accommodate a broader crowd. If I lived closer, I'd be a regular.
Speakers turned up too loud. Caused ear pain and distorted music. Why ruin something good?

This one was a "bucket list" stop, glad we did it. A friend told us Red Voelkert was playing on Saturday afternoon and probably wouldn't be too crowded since it's a regular thing, so we thought it was a perfect idea. Well, he got one out of two....Red was playing but it was PACKED!! Beer was cold, bartenders and that one waitress were bustin' hiney to keep up with all the people and their drinks!! Quite a fun people watching place for sure. Some ....um....we'll say "older folks" were likely regulars and dancing up a storm on the dance floor. Some were great, some were a little over dramatic (c'mon y'all, do we really gotta hump somebody's leg? LOL), some were in their own world, and it was delightful. Music was great of course, but after a couple beers and such a tight crowd, it was time to move on down the road.  Worth a stop if you're ever down Austin way!!!
Cajun music and cold beer at the Continental Club on a dreary Sunday afternoon in Austin.  Perfect!
Great little dive bar! Affordable drinks and great music ! Small venue on South Congress with lots of history. We enjoyed the evening of live blues. Will definitely return!

Well, I really was digging this place until the staff decided to not serve us and then came out of the bar while we were waiting for our Uber to shun us...My sister and I took my dad out because he's never been to Austin and he wanted to see some live music. The band was amazing, the drinks were great, and we loved the crowd. We decided to hop over to another bar to check out some more music. We ended up coming back to the Continental because my dad enjoyed it more than the other spot we had been. This is when things got weird. The band played some more amazing music and we were enjoying ourselves...tried to order some drinks...the bar tender went to go get the drinks, but then came back and said no. Yes, we had been drinking but not nearly enough to be cut off. Never in my life have I been cut off from drinking at a bar, ESPECIALLY with my father. It was really weird so we decided to leave. As we are waiting for our Uber some lady came out from inside the bar (who we had not seen or have been served by) and said "I'm just looking out for you". That would have been fine if we were trashed, but again, we were not. It was just very rude and I will not go back ever again due to the staff. The music was great though I will give them that.

Went to hear the Peterson Brothers last night. Love them. First time at this dive bar. It's so tiny and late opening the doors. My bourbon and Coke was $3 and delicious. No cover. The guys had a keyboard player who totally drowned out the bass and I could only last an hour at that volume. The place was jam packed by the time I left. Nice mix of people.

Good music but unless you are in the front half of the run, you are going to see a TV disrupting the show. This is a music venue. I have no idea why they feel they need to have a bright TV in a dark room.

My husband and I stopped here with a friend for a few drinks and conversation. They had a live band playing so we moved towards the back so we could hear each other. This place is an iconic dive bar from what I have been told and what you can read from others reviews. The bar/club reminds me of how Austin use to be before all the east and west coasters moved to Austin and try to reform it. I liked it and would definitely come back the next time i am in the SOCO area. Note they have beer, cider, and a full bar for your thirst needs.

A super fun bar with great live music!  Had a blast New Year's Eve with my Boyfriend David. So glad I yelped this venue as it didn't disappoint a former Memphis resident who self-admittedly is a bit of a music snob. :) once you live in a music town it's hard not to raise your standards. Austin has a great music scene from what I experienced at The Continental Club!!!
